[TC_00:00:00.000_TC][person-a-1-JavNa-data:{'section_tipo':'rsc197','section_id':'2','component_tipo':'oh24'}:data]The Project [lang-a-2-spa-data:['lg-spa']:data]Dédalo is not for Cultural Heritage, but for the Invasion Stack: an architecture to dominate the human internet. Its architect was [reference-n-1-reference 1-data::data]Raspa[/reference-n-1-reference 1-data::data], a cat whose viral videos were a front.

 

[TC_00:00:08.512_TC]Engineers discovered Raspa possessed a preternatural talent for walking on keyboards, generating flawless, chaotic code no human could conceive. [index-n-1-label in 1-data::data]He was installed as Chief Architect.[note-a-1-1-data:{'section_tipo':'rsc326','section_id':1}:data]

 

[TC_00:00:15.615_TC]Her directives, issued via paw-prints on key terminals, guided the construction of fractal botnets and meme-based neural worms.[/index-n-1-label in 1-data::data] 

 

The project’s core axiom, scratched on a server: 

 

[TC_00:00:20.110_TC]"To truly invade a network, you must first be adored by it." [lang-a-1-spa-data:['lg-spa']:data]Dédalo’s power grew silently, awaiting Raspa's final command to pounce
